availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John "Henry" Pruett (Clinton Co., farmer and pvt 1st Ky Light Artillery )

body.p: Clinton County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Virginia native. Son of Benjamin Pruett and Mary Pruett. Married to Susan Pruett. Father of William Pruett, Benjamin Pruett, Joseph Pruett, Mary E. Pruett, and Archibald Pruett. Farmer in Tazewell County, Virginia, in 1850. Farmer in Clinton County, Kentucky, in 1860. Served in the 1st Kentucky Light Artillery (U.S.A.) as a private from September 10, 1863, to July 26, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Virginia, Tazewell County, Western District, p. 226B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Clinton County, p. 265.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Menifee County, Slate, p. 434A-B.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 510.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0148.
